info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 02 at 2:06PM PDT until September 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 280, 281, 282, 284, 617, 620, 621, 622, 623, 624, AND 625... * AFFECTED AREA... -In NorCal...Eastern fire weather zone 280. This includes the McKinney fire, The Yeti Complex, the Mill fire in Weed fire and all of fire weather zones 281, 282, and 284. -In Oregon...Eastern portions of fire weather zone 617. Fire zones 620, 621, 622, 623, 624 and 625. This includes eastern Douglas, almost all of Jackson and Josephine counties, the Rum Creek fire, and all areas east of there. * WIND...For areas west of the Cascades...West to northwest winds 10 to 15 mph with gusts of 20 to 25 mph. From the Cascades eastward...Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. Higher wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are possible over higher elevations of fire zones 623, 624 and 625. For the Shasta Valley south winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts in excess of 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...8 to 15 percent. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
